page.title: 03ECOLOGY CONTINUED.
page.content: THE SECOND AREA OF WOODLAND STUDIED WAS A SMALL COPSE EITHER SIDE OF A STREAM CALLED LONCO BROOK AT WHITLEYFORD BRIDGE, GRID SQUARE 03740323. THIS COPSE IS NOT MARKED ON THE MAP BUT HAS GROWN FOLLOWING THE COURSE OF THE STREAM. THE FIELDS EITHER SIDE OF THE BROOK ARE USED FOR ARABLE FARMING. AN INTERESTING POINT IS THAT THE SHROPSHIRE /STAFFORDSHIRE COUNTY BOUNDARY FOLLOWS THE STREAM AND THE OLD ROMAN ROAD "GORSY LANE". THE MAIN SPECIES OF TREE WAS WILLOW BECAUSE OF THE WETTER ENVIRONMENT. ON THE STREAM BANKS ABOVE THE WILLOWS WERE HAWTHORN, ASH AND OAK WHERE IT WAS DRIER. NEXT TO THE SANDSTONE BRIDGE, IN A MORE OPEN AREA WERE TALL AND DENSE AREAS OF NETTLES AND GRASSES. AMONG THE WILLOW TREES GREW NETTLES AND CAMPIONS. WITHIN THE COPSE, IN A SHELTERED HOLLOW, WE FOUND
